university_name: École Nationale Supérieure des Mines de Paris (MINES ParisTech)
module_restrictions: Students must have completed at least 5 semesters of undergraduate studies before participating in exchange programme at MINES ParisTech.
Not all the courses are open to visiting students due to limited number of places.
visa_info: Long-Stay visas are necessary for stays exceeding 3 months.

Upon arrival in France, students are required to register with the French Immigration and Integration Office (OFII) for a residence permit. Students must follow the Campus France procedure on Etudes en France online platform before applying for a visa.
accommodations_info: Accommodation offered to visiting students, if available, will be at either MINES ParisTech residences - Maison des Mines or Cité Internationale Universitaire de Paris (CIUP).
university_description: École Nationale Supérieure des Mines de Paris (MINES ParisTech) is a graduate school in the French higher education institution structure.
location_cost_of_living: Paris is known to be expensive, with high costs for accommodation, food, and entertainment.
location_weather: Paris has a temperate oceanic climate, with mild winters and warm summers.
location_description: Paris is the capital city of France, known for its art, architecture, cuisine, and museums. It is a major center for business, fashion, and culture.
location_crime: Paris has a moderate crime rate, with pickpocketing being a common occurrence. However, violent crime is rare.
location_transportation: Paris has an extensive public transportation system, including an extensive metro and bus network.
location_halal: Paris has a wide selection of halal food options, with many restaurants and markets catering to Muslim dietary restrictions.
location_vegetarian: Paris has many vegetarian and vegan restaurants, as well as supermarkets and markets offering vegetarian options.
